    • Method Detail

      • parseNewOrder

        public static void parseNewOrder(java.lang.String line)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This method parses a line of input text representing a command to add or remove an offer/bid. It uses regular expressions to parse the line and then calls the appropriate function to add or remove the order.
        Parameters:
        line - This is a line from the log book
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addOrder

        public static void addOrder(java.lang.String timestamp,
                            java.lang.String order_id,
                            java.lang.String side,
                            double price,
                            int size)
        This method adds a new order to the appropriate buer or seller log book. If there is an update to the min/max buy/sell cost it will be printed to System.out.
        Parameters:
        order_id - The unique identifier of the order
        side - The side of the order (buy | sell)
        price - The price of the order
        size - The number of shares in the order

      • removeOrder

        public static void removeOrder(java.lang.String timestamp,
                               java.lang.String order_id,
                               int size)
        This method removes an order from the log. It identifies whether the order is on the buy or sell side and calls the appropriate method in the buyer or seller objects. If there is an update to the min/max buy/sell cost, then it is printed to System.out.
        Parameters:
        order_id - The unique identifier of the order
        size - The number of shares in the order

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method for the pricer program. It takes a command line argument for the target number of shares to buy/sell. Then, it iterates over lines of input on STDIN until it reaches a null value.
        Parameters:
        target_shares - The target number of shares to buy and sell
